intro: Nothopanax macintyrei, commonly known as the MacIntyre's nothopanax, is a tropical plant native to the rainforests of Queensland, Australia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, followed by spherical fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understorey of dense forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
